item.title: Excessive leaves on footpath and road - thicket road and crystal palace park road, 9th December
item.description:
Excessive leaves on footpath and road which appear to be washing down from thicket road, possible blocked road drains. Treacherous as the area has high foot traffice as this area is a busy entrance to the park.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Thicket Road, Crystal Palace, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Big tree at the bottom of Kenilworth Road near 33, 9th December
item.description:
Lots of big cardboard boxes dumped by this tree and with address labels still attached: 33A Kenilworth Road plus name of the individual and household that is continuing to use this tree as their dumping ground. This is wholly unacceptable. This is a pattern of behaviour that needs to be stopped please? Why should people think it acceptable to do this when we have a recycling service - it is because they do not care. I think you should make them care and show them that Brent cares.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Kenilworth Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Fly-tip Small - Less than one bag

item.title: Rain garden damaged by incompetent drivers, 9th December
item.description:
Yet again the rain garden on the corner of Turle Crescent has been vandalised (protection deliberately removed) and then damaged by incompetent drivers who are unable to turn corners. They need replacing with the metal bell bollards please!

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Tollington Park, Finsbury Park, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Taxis and others park in front of Grand Royale Hotel on Inverness street blocking traffic, 9th December
item.description:
Taxis and lorries alike are parking regularly on the single yellow line in front of The Grand Royale Hotel on Inverness Terrace, bringing the traffic to a standstill on a regular basis day and night, therefore causing unnecessary disturbance and noise. The situation is rather unbearable and could be rectified rather quickly by allowing for a designated taxi bay and or a loading bay in front if the hotel. Thank you.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1-9, Inverness Terrace, Bayswater, City of Westminster
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Manning court ground floor entrance door, 9th December
item.description:
